caption.p: Euphorbia cuneata (EC) ameliorated lipopolysaccharide (LPS)-induced lipid peroxidation and increased antioxidant parameters in the lung. ( A) Malondialdehyde (MDA), ( B) 4-hydroxynonenal (4-HNE), ( C) catalase, ( D) superoxide dismutase (SOD), ( E) reduced glutathione (GSH), ( F) total antioxidant capacity (TAC). Mice were treated with two different doses of EC (25 and 50 mg/kg) or dexamethasone (5 mg/kg) once daily for 5 days prior to intraperitoneal injection of LPS (10 mg/kg). Samples were collected 24 h after LPS injection. Parameters were estimated in the supernatants of the lung homogenates. Data are the mean Â± SD. ( n = 8). ** p < 0.01, *** p < 0.001 vs. control group; # p < 0.05, ## p < 0.01, ### p < 0.001 vs. LPS group; && p < 0.01, &&& p < 0.001 vs. DEX + LPS group (one-way ANOVA).
